alert.note: Alert for San Juan and Vicinity (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 18 at 12:19PM ADT until September 19 at 1:45AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Puerto Rico and Virgin Islands, including the following areas, in Puerto Rico, Central Interior, Culebra, Eastern Interior, Mayaguez and Vicinity, North Central, Northeast, Northwest, Ponce and Vicinity, San Juan and Vicinity, Southeast, Southwest, Vieques and Western Interior. In Virgin Islands, St Croix and St.Thomas...St. John...and Adjacent Islands. * WHEN...Through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rain from Hurricane Fiona continues to affect the islands. The main area of rainfall associated with the storm continues to affect all local islands. Periods of moderate to heavy rainfall are expected, both as the system moves through the region, as well as in the enhanced moisture that will persist over the area for several days. Life-threatening to catastrophic flooding is expected. The heaviest rainfall is expected for today through Monday. Rainfall totals of 5 to 10 inches are expected for much of the region, including the U.S. Virgin Islands, with locally higher amounts. In southern Puerto Rico, however, rainfall amounts of 12 to 16 inches are anticipated, and locally higher amounts to around 20 to 25 inches are possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
